src:
Modal RM5 jual RM50 [METROTV]
03 Nov 2019, 10:00 by Mohd Jamilul Anbia Md Denin



ADA antara mereka sudah bergelar jutawan muda dengan memiliki jet peribadi dan kapal layar mewah hasil penjualan cecair perisa vape mengandungi nikotin.
Malah, risikan sejak beberapa bulan lalu mendapati cecair vape mengandungi nikotin tanpa lesen dihasilkan di negara ini turut dieksport ke serata dunia hingga ke Kanada, Chile, Pakistan, Colombia, Mexico, Bulgaria, Bolivia, Paraguay dan Asia Barat.
Jurucakap Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) berkata, kegiatan pengilangan cecair perisa vape yang semakin bercambah di negara ini jelas memberi keuntungan besar kepada golongan ini.
Menurutnya, risikan KKM mendapati mereka hanya perlu menyeludup masuk cecair nikotin yang menjadi ibu vape atau bahan wajib bagi menghasilkan adunan perisa vape.
“Berdasar siasatan, setiap satu gelen nikotin bersamaan 3.785 liter boleh digunakan bagi menghasilkan kira-kira 400,000 botol cecair perisa vape.
“Setiap botol kecil cecair vape dihasilkan dengan modal sekitar RM3 ke RM5 sebelum dijual pada harga antara RM30 hingga RM50 sebotol kepada pelanggan tempatan.
“Malah harganya boleh meningkat berkali ganda jika dieksport ke luar negara,” katanya.


RAMPASAN cecair vape yang mengandungi nikotin oleh Penguatkuasa Farmasi. FOTO ihsan Farmasi

Menurutnya, siasatan dilakukan sebelum ini mendapati, pengilang cecair vape mencampurkan cecair nikotin dalam kuantiti tinggi hingga ada antaranya mencecah sehingga 50 miligram bagi setiap botol kecil.
“Kandungan nikotin ini tinggi dan mampu mendatangkan kesan buruk kepada kesihatan termasuk menjadi punca kanser, kerosakan paru-paru selain mati mengejut seperti mana kes berlaku kepada pengguna vape di Amerika Syarikat dan United Kingdom,” katanya.
Beliau berkata, KKM sebelum ini menasihati penjual, pengedar, pengilang dan pengimport untuk menghentikan serta-merta aktiviti pengilangan, pengedaran serta penjualan cecair vape mengandungi nikotin.
“KKM akan meneruskan pemantauan serta menjalankan operasi berterusan dengan pelbagai pihak bagi memastikan penjualan cecair rokok elektronik atau vape bernikotin dapat dibanteras.
“Nikotin adalah racun Kumpulan C dan dikawal sepenuhnya penggunaan mengikut Akta Racun 1952 [Akta 366].
“Penjualan nikotin secara berleluasa tanpa lesen sah adalah satu kesalahan mengikut akta ini dan jika didapati bersalah boleh dihukum mengikut Seksyen 32(2) akta itu iaitu denda tidak melebihi RM3,000 atau penjara tidak melebihi satu tahun atau kedua-duanya sekali,” katanya.

Kilang jual jus minuman konon!

Cuba memperdaya pegawai Bahagian Penguatkuasaan Farmasi (BPF) Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) kononnya kilang diserbu hanya menghasilkan botol minuman jus asam jawa.
Itu antara taktik pihak syarikat pengeluar cecair perisa vape mengandungi nikotin tanpa lesen di Tampin, Negeri Sembilan yang diserbu pihak BPF petang Khamis lalu.
Kilang cecair perisa vape itu antara 29 kilang yang diserbu KKM sejak Khamis lalu, di seluruh negara selepas dikenal pasti menghasilkan cecair perisa vape nikotin.
Dalam serbuan di Tampin itu, penyelia kilang cuba memperdaya pegawai BPF dengan mendakwa kilang ditutup dengan zink itu milik syarikat lain yang menghasilkan jus minum.
Bagaimanapun, helah itu tidak berjaya apabila pegawai BPF nekad mengangkat pintu besi kilang itu beramai-ramai sebelum siasatan terperinci dilakukan.
Hasil pemeriksaan dilakukan di premis itu menemui berpuluh botol cecair nikotin seludup dianggarkan seberat 207 liter yang disembunyikan di dalam peti sejuk di belakang premis.
Malah, dalam pemeriksaan di lokasi kedua terletak 500 meter dari premis pertama, syarikat cecair vape dikesan menggunakan papan tanda tertera tulisan kilang besi bertujuan mengaburi pihak berkuasa.
Namun sebaik mangga kilang besi itu dipotong, pegawai BPF menemui dua gudang besar digunakan untuk menyimpan ratusan ribu botol perisa vape sudah diproses dan dikotakkan.
Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan Malaysia, Datuk Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah berkata, pegawai BPF dari ibu pejabat dibantu pegawai enam Cawangan Penguatkuasaan Farmasi (CPF) Selangor, Kuala Lumpur dan Putrajaya, Negeri Sembilan, Pulau Pinang, Kedah dan Terengganu terbabit dalam operasi sejak Khamis lalu bagi membanteras cecair vape mengandungi nikotin.
Menurutnya, pihaknya merampas nikotin dan 35,439 item perisa vape mengandungi nikotin bernilai RM6.38 juta.
“Tindakan ini diambil rentetan penjualan nikotin tanpa lesen racun yang sah. Malah penjualannya didapati semakin berleluasa termasuk di platform e-dagang dan media sosial.
“Operasi bersepadu kali ini dilaksanakan hasil risikan oleh KKM ke atas aduan dan maklumat diterima daripada orang awam berkenaan penjualan rokok elektronik yang mengandungi cecair nikotin kepada orang ramai khususnya golongan pelajar sekolah dan belia,” katanya.
Dalam pada itu, Dr Noor Hisham berkata, orang ramai boleh mengemukakan aduan dan menyalurkan maklumat berkenaan penjualan cecair rokok elektronik mengandungi nikotin kepada BPF atau melalui laman sesawang http://www.pharmacy.gov.my atau mana-mana cawangan BPF yang berdekatan.
Selain itu katanya, penjualan cecair vape nikotin boleh juga dilaporkan di talian 03-78413200 supaya tindakan sewajarnya dapat diambil bagi membanteras penjualan produk berkenaan di pasaran.


PEGAWAI KKM menjalankan operasi bersepadu ke atas kilang cecair vape di Negeri Sembilan dan Selangor. FOTO ihsan Farmasi


Berita Berkaitan
text:
RM5 is RM50 [METROTV]
03 Nov 2019, 10:00 by Mohd Jamilul Anbia Md Denin



Some of them are already young millionaires with private jets and luxury yachts from the sale of vape flavored liquids containing nicotine.
In fact, intelligence in recent months has found that vape fluids containing unlicensed nicotine in the country have also been exported worldwide to Canada, Chile, Pakistan, Colombia, Mexico, Bulgaria, Bolivia, Paraguay and West Asia.
A spokesman for the Ministry of Health Malaysia (MOH) said the growing vape-flavored liquid manufacturing activity in the country was a huge benefit to this group.
According to MOH intelligence, they found that they only had to smuggle in nicotine fluids into vape mothers or compulsory substances to produce vape flavored dough.
“According to the investigation, each gallon of 3,785 liters of nicotine can be used to produce about 400,000 bottles of vape flavored liquids.
“Each bottle of vape liquid is made with a capital of around RM3 to RM5 before being sold for between RM30 and RM50 a bottle to local customers.
"It can even be doubled if exported overseas," he said.


APPROVAL of vape fluid containing nicotine by Pharmaceutical Authorities. PHOTO courtesy of Pharmacy

According to previous investigations, vape liquid manufacturers mixed nicotine fluids in high quantities with some reaching up to 50 milligrams per small bottle.
"This nicotine content is high and can have adverse effects on health including cancer, lung damage and sudden death as is the case with vape users in the United States and the United Kingdom," he said.
He said MOH had previously advised sellers, distributors, manufacturers and importers to immediately stop the manufacture, distribution and sale of vape fluid containing nicotine.
“MoH will continue to monitor and conduct ongoing operations with various parties to ensure the sale of electronic cigarette or vape-friendly vapors.
“Nicotine is a Group C poison and is fully regulated under the Poisons Act 1952 [Act 366].
"The widespread sale of nicotine without a valid license is an offense under this act and if found guilty, can be punished under Section 32 (2) of the fine not exceeding RM3,000 or imprisonment not exceeding one year or both," he said.

The juice shop says so!

Trying to trick the Pharmaceutical Enforcement Division (BPF) officials of the Ministry of Health (MOH) said the factory was raiding only bottled juice.
That was among the tactics of a vape-flavored liquid manufacturing company containing unlicensed nicotine in Tampin, Negeri Sembilan which was raided by the BPF last Thursday.
The vape flavoring plant is among 29 factories that have been raided by MOH since Thursday, nationwide after it was identified to produce nicotine vape flavored liquids.
In the Tampin raid, a factory supervisor tried to trick BPF officials by claiming that the plant was closed with a zinc belonging to another company producing juice.
However, the trick was unsuccessful when BPF officials determined to raise the factory's iron doors in the open before a detailed investigation was carried out.
Investigations on the premises found dozens of bottles of smuggled nicotine fluid weighing 207 liters hidden in the refrigerator behind the premises.
In fact, in an inspection at the second location located 500 meters from the first premises, a vape liquid company was found using an iron mill signboard to obscure the authorities.
But once the steel mill was cut, BPF officials discovered two warehouses were used to store hundreds of thousands of bottles of vape flavored and processed.
Malaysian Health director-general Datuk Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah said BPF officers from the headquarters assisted six Selangor Pharmaceutical Enforcement (CPF) officers in Kuala Lumpur and Putrajaya, Negeri Sembilan, Penang, Kedah and Terengganu in operation since Thursday to counteract vape fluid contains nicotine.
According to him, he seized nicotine and 35,439 vape flavored items containing RM6.38 million worth of nicotine.
“This action was taken on a string of nicotine sales without a valid poison license. In fact, sales have been rampant including on e-commerce and social media platforms.
"This integrated operation was carried out as a result of the MOH's investigation of complaints and information received from the public regarding the sale of electronic cigarettes containing nicotine fluids to the public, especially for school and youth students," he said.
In the meantime, Dr Noor Hisham said people could submit complaints and distribute information on the sale of electronic cigarettes containing nicotine to BPF or through the website http://www.pharmacy.gov.my or any other BPF branch.
In addition, he said the sale of nicotine vape fluid can also be reported at 03-78413200 so that appropriate action can be taken to counter the sale of the product in the market.


MOH officials are conducting integrated operations on vape fluid factories in Negeri Sembilan and Selangor. PHOTO courtesy of Pharmacy
